SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A. NEL OF EXPLANATION TO THE PERSON ANSWERING THIS QUESTIONNAIRE.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has actually experienced pioneer life. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about answering them. You may have stories of pioneer life which are not included in this questionnaire. You may hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1931, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires.

Western Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer File: What Did Our Canadian Pioneers Leave Behind" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered it, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

If later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

Preservation of Questionnaires

Office all questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:
